author: Caroline Hendrie For The Mail On Sunday
title: Cruise companies that don't discriminate against single travellers
text:
1
View
comments
A cruise makes a great holiday choice for solo travellers but some lines tend to discourage singletons by slapping on supplements, which can double the price.
So to get the best deals, go to an agent such as Go Cruise or luxury specialist Mundy Cruising .
They keep an eye on which lines are offering low or no single supplements and when. Not only will it mean a saving for you, there are likely to be more solo passengers on your ship.
Kirker Holidays offers classical music-themed holidays on Fred Olsen’s Black Watch for a group of up to 50 (half travelling solo) who have their own programme of concerts and excursions
Luxury line Crystal Cruises offers single supplements as low as ten per cent – if you time it right.
It has a singles programme that includes dinner parties for eight guests in the restaurants that make for a convivial atmosphere.
Cruise & Maritime specialises in no-fly cruises on small ships. Aboard its vessel Magellan are 150 twin cabins that are set aside for single occupancy, with a supplement of 25 per cent.
A good way to enjoy cruising with like-minded companions is to book through a special-interest tour operator.

Kirker Holidays offers classical music-themed holidays on Fred Olsen’s Black Watch for a group of up to 50 (half travelling solo) who have their own programme of concerts and excursions.
A 13-night, no-fly cruise from Dover to Norway sailing on June 12, 2016 costs from £3,085 for solos (from £2,210pp sharing).
If you enjoy walking, join R amblers Worldwide on a new, Iberia ‘cruise and walk’ trip aboard Fred Olsen’s Balmoral. A 14-night trip leaves Southampton on October 25.
Your group of up to 20 will have guided walks ashore in Morocco, Spain and Portugal. The cost is £2,191 in a single cabin.
Luxury line Crystal Cruises offers single supplements as low as ten per cent
If you prefer a large ship but don’t want to get lost in the crowd, Norwegian Cruise Line has the solution.
Its ships Epic, Breakaway, Getaway and Escape each have an enclave with one-passenger cabins and a lounge and bar where single guests can meet.
A seven-night western Mediterranean fly- cruise sailing from Barcelona aboard Norwegian Epic on November 22 costs from £844pp, including flights.
TRAVEL FACTS: Plan your own Singles Cruise P&O’s Britannia now has purpose-built single cabins with balconies – they cost from £2,999pp on a 15-night Caribbean cruise departing Barbados on December 2 including flights.
